Global Beatles Day.title: Global Beatles Day
Global Beatles Day.image_prompt: A vibrant scene with Beatles memorabilia, fans celebrating, and iconic Beatles imagery like Abbey Road and Sgt. Pepper's album cover

facts.1: Celebrated to honor the ideals of the Beatles, including peace, love, and the expansion of human consciousness.
facts.2: The date marks the anniversary of the Beatles' performance of 'All You Need Is Love' on the BBC program 'Our World' in 1967.
facts.3: Fans celebrate by listening to Beatles music, watching Beatles movies, and sharing their favorite Beatles memories.

World Vitiligo Day.title: World Vitiligo Day
World Vitiligo Day.image_prompt: A supportive community event with people of diverse skin tones, educational booths about vitiligo, and symbols of unity and awareness

facts.1: Observed to raise awareness about vitiligo, a skin condition causing loss of pigmentation.
facts.2: The day is in memory of Michael Jackson, who publicly revealed his struggle with vitiligo.
facts.3: Events aim to educate the public, support those affected by vitiligo, and promote research for better treatments.

Day of the Seafarer.title: Day of the Seafarer
Day of the Seafarer.image_prompt: A maritime scene with seafarers on a ship, ocean waves, and elements of international trade like cargo containers and ports

facts.1: Recognizes the contribution of seafarers to international trade and the global economy.
facts.2: Established by the International Maritime Organization (IMO) in 2010.
facts.3: Activities include campaigns to improve working conditions for seafarers and raise awareness about their challenges.
